CVE-2013-0131.title: NVIDIA Drivers: Privilege escalation — GLSA 201304-01
CVE-2013-0131.subTitle: Two vulnerabilities in NVIDIA drivers may allow a local attacker to gain escalated privileges.
CVE-2013-0131.background: The NVIDIA drivers provide X11 and GLX support for NVIDIA graphic boards.
CVE-2013-0131.body: Two vulnerabilities have been discovered in NVIDIA drivers:
CVE-2013-0131.extra: NOTE: Exposure to CVE-2012-4225 is reduced in Gentoo due to 660 permissions being used on the GPU device nodes by default.

CVE-2013-0151.title: Xen: Multiple vulnerabilities — GLSA 201309-24
CVE-2013-0151.subTitle: Multiple vulnerabilities have been found in Xen, allowing attackers on a Xen Virtual Machine to execute arbitrary code, cause Denial of Service, or gain access to data on the host.
CVE-2013-0151.body: Multiple vulnerabilities have been discovered in Xen. Please review the CVE identifiers referenced below for details.
CVE-2013-0151.extra: Guest domains could possibly gain privileges, execute arbitrary code, or cause a Denial of Service on the host domain (Dom0). Additionally, guest domains could gain information about other virtual machines running on the same host or read arbitrary files on the host.

CVE-2013-0152.title: Xen: Multiple vulnerabilities — GLSA 201309-24
CVE-2013-0152.subTitle: Multiple vulnerabilities have been found in Xen, allowing attackers on a Xen Virtual Machine to execute arbitrary code, cause Denial of Service, or gain access to data on the host.
CVE-2013-0152.body: Multiple vulnerabilities have been discovered in Xen. Please review the CVE identifiers referenced below for details.
CVE-2013-0152.extra: Guest domains could possibly gain privileges, execute arbitrary code, or cause a Denial of Service on the host domain (Dom0). Additionally, guest domains could gain information about other virtual machines running on the same host or read arbitrary files on the host.

CVE-2013-0169.title: IcedTea JDK: Multiple vulnerabilities — GLSA 201406-32
CVE-2013-0169.subTitle: Multiple vulnerabilities have been found in the IcedTea JDK, the worst of which could lead to arbitrary code execution.
CVE-2013-0169.background: IcedTea is a distribution of the Java OpenJDK source code built with free build tools.
CVE-2013-0169.body: Multiple vulnerabilities have been discovered in the IcedTea JDK. Please review the CVE identifiers referenced below for details.
CVE-2013-0169.extra: A remote attacker could possibly execute arbitrary code with the privileges of the process, cause a Denial of Service condition, obtain sensitive information, bypass intended security policies, or have other unspecified impact.

CVE-2013-0242.title: GNU C Library: Multiple vulnerabilities — GLSA 201503-04
CVE-2013-0242.subTitle: Multiple vulnerabilities have been found in GNU C Library, the worst of which allowing a local attacker to execute arbitrary code or cause a Denial of Service .
CVE-2013-0242.background: The GNU C library is the standard C library used by Gentoo Linux systems.
CVE-2013-0242.body: Multiple vulnerabilities have been discovered in the GNU C Library. Please review the CVE identifiers referenced below for details.
CVE-2013-0242.extra: A local attacker may be able to execute arbitrary code or cause a Denial of Service condition,.

CVE-2013-0289.title: isync: Man-in-the-Middle attack — GLSA 201310-02
CVE-2013-0289.subTitle: A vulnerability in isync could allow remote attackers to perform man-in-the-middle attacks.
CVE-2013-0289.background: isync is an IMAP and MailDir mailbox synchronizer.
CVE-2013-0289.body: isync does not properly verify the server’s hostname against the CN field in the SSL certificate.
CVE-2013-0289.extra: A remote server could perform man-in-the-middle attacks to disclose passwords or obtain other sensitive information.

CVE-2013-0334.title: Bundler: Insecure installation — GLSA 201609-02
CVE-2013-0334.subTitle: A vulnerability has been found in Bundler, allowing injection of arbitrary code via the gem installation process.
CVE-2013-0334.background: Bundler provides a consistent environment for Ruby projects by tracking and installing the exact gems and versions that are needed.
CVE-2013-0334.body: Bundler, allows the installation of gems from different sources with the same names, when multiple top-level gem sources are used.
CVE-2013-0334.extra: Remote attackers could inject arbitrary code via the gem install process.

CVE-2013-0337.title: nginx: Multiple vulnerabilities — GLSA 201310-04
CVE-2013-0337.subTitle: Multiple vulnerabilities have been found in nginx, the worst of which may allow execution of arbitrary code.
CVE-2013-0337.background: nginx is a robust, small, and high performance HTTP and reverse proxy server.
CVE-2013-0337.body: Multiple vulnerabilities have been discovered in nginx. Please review the CVE identifiers referenced below for details.
CVE-2013-0337.extra: A remote attacker could send a specially crafted request, possibly resulting in execution of arbitrary code with the privileges of the process, or a Denial of Service condition. Furthermore, a context-dependent attacker may be able to obtain sensitive information.

CVE-2013-0375.title: MySQL: Multiple vulnerabilities — GLSA 201308-06
CVE-2013-0375.subTitle: Multiple vulnerabilities have been found in MySQL, allowing attackers to execute arbitrary code or cause Denial of Service.
CVE-2013-0375.background: MySQL is a fast, multi-threaded, multi-user SQL database server.
CVE-2013-0375.body: Multiple vulnerabilities have been discovered in MySQL. Please review the CVE identifiers referenced below for details.
CVE-2013-0375.extra: A remote attacker could send a specially crafted request, possibly resulting in execution of arbitrary code with the privileges of the application or a Denial of Service condition.

CVE-2013-4122.title: Cyrus-SASL: Denial of service — GLSA 201309-01
CVE-2013-4122.subTitle: A NULL pointer dereference in Cyrus-SASL may allow remote attackers to cause a Denial of Service condition.
CVE-2013-4122.background: Cyrus-SASL is an implementation of the Simple Authentication and Security Layer.
CVE-2013-4122.body: In the GNU C Library (glibc) from version 2.17 onwards, the crypt() function call can return NULL when the salt violates specifications or the system is in FIPS-140 mode and a DES or MD5 hashed password is passed. When Cyrus-SASL’s authentication mechanisms call crypt(), a NULL may be returned.
CVE-2013-4122.extra: A remote attacker could trigger this vulnerability to cause a Denial of Service condition.

CVE-2013-4362.title: DavFS2: Local privilege escalation — GLSA 201612-02
CVE-2013-4362.subTitle: A vulnerability in DavFS2 allows local users to gain root privileges.
CVE-2013-4362.background: DavFS2 is a file system driver that allows you to mount a WebDAV server as a local disk drive.
CVE-2013-4362.body: DavFS2 installs “/usr/sbin/mount.davfs” as setuid root. This utility uses “system()” to call “/sbin/modprobe”.
CVE-2013-4362.extra: While the call to “modprobe” itself cannot be manipulated, a local authenticated user can set the “MODPROBE_OPTIONS” environment variable to pass a user controlled path, allowing the loading of an arbitrary kernel module.

CVE-2013-6629.body: Multiple vulnerabilities have been discovered in the IcedTea JDK. Please review the CVE identifiers referenced below for details.

CVE-2013-6629.title: libjpeg-turbo: Multiple vulnerabilities — GLSA 201606-03
CVE-2013-6629.subTitle: Two vulnerabilities have been discovered in libjpeg-turbo, the worse of which could allow remote attackers access to sensitive information.
CVE-2013-6629.background: libjpeg-turbo is a MMX, SSE, and SSE2 SIMD accelerated JPEG library
CVE-2013-6629.body: libjpeg-turbo does not check for certain duplications of component data during the reading of segments that follow Start Of Scan (SOS) JPEG markers.
CVE-2013-6629.extra: Remote attackers could obtain sensitive information from uninitialized memory locations via a crafted JPEG images.

CVE-2013-6671.title: Mozilla Products: Multiple vulnerabilities — GLSA 201504-01
CVE-2013-6671.subTitle: Multiple vulnerabilities have been found in Mozilla Firefox, Thunderbird, and SeaMonkey, the worst of which may allow user-assisted execution of arbitrary code.
CVE-2013-6671.background: Mozilla Firefox is an open-source web browser and Mozilla Thunderbird an open-source email client, both from the Mozilla Project. The SeaMonkey project is a community effort to deliver production-quality releases of code derived from the application formerly known as the ‘Mozilla Application Suite’.
CVE-2013-6671.body: Multiple vulnerabilities have been discovered in Firefox, Thunderbird, and SeaMonkey. Please review the CVE identifiers referenced below for details.
CVE-2013-6671.extra: A remote attacker could entice a user to view a specially crafted web page or email, possibly resulting in execution of arbitrary code or a Denial of Service condition. Furthermore, a remote attacker may be able to perform Man-in-the-Middle attacks, obtain sensitive information, spoof the address bar, conduct clickjacking attacks, bypass security restrictions and protection mechanisms, or have other unspecified impact.

CVE-2013-7252.title: kwalletd: Information disclosure — GLSA 201606-19
CVE-2013-7252.subTitle: Kwalletd password stores are vulnerable to codebook attacks.
CVE-2013-7252.background: Kwalletd is is a credentials management application for KDE.
CVE-2013-7252.body: Kwalletd in KWallet uses Blowfish with ECB mode instead of CBC mode when encrypting the password store.
CVE-2013-7252.extra: Local attackers, with access to the password store, could conduct a codebook attack in order to obtain confidential passwords.

CVE-2013-7296.title: Poppler: Multiple vulnerabilities — GLSA 201401-21
CVE-2013-7296.subTitle: Multiple vulnerabilities have been found in Poppler, allowing remote attackers to execute arbitrary code or cause a Denial of Service condition.
CVE-2013-7296.background: Poppler is a cross-platform PDF rendering library originally based on Xpdf.
CVE-2013-7296.body: Multiple vulnerabilities have been discovered in Poppler. Please review the CVE identifiers referenced below for details.
CVE-2013-7296.extra: A remote attacker could entice a user to open a specially crafted PDF in an application linked against Poppler, possibly resulting in execution of arbitrary code with the privileges of the process or a Denial of Service condition.

CVE-2013-7338.extra: A context-dependent attacker may be able to execute arbitrary code or cause a Denial of Service condition.

CVE-2013-7383.title: X2Go Server: Privilege Escalation — GLSA 201405-26
CVE-2013-7383.subTitle: A local privilege escalation vulnerability has been discovered in X2Go Server.
CVE-2013-7383.background: X2Go is an open source terminal server project.
CVE-2013-7383.body: X2Go Server is prone to a local privilege-escalation vulnerability.
CVE-2013-7383.extra: A local attacker could gain escalated privileges.

CVE-2013-7401.title: c-icap: Denial of service — GLSA 201409-07
CVE-2013-7401.subTitle: A vulnerability in c-icap could result in Denial of Service.
CVE-2013-7401.background: c-icap is an implementation of an ICAP server. It can be used with HTTP proxies that support the ICAP protocol to implement content adaptation and filtering services.
CVE-2013-7401.body: c-icap contains a flaw in the parse_request() function of request.c that may allow a remote denial of service. The issue is triggered when the buffer fails to contain a ‘ ‘ or ‘?’ symbol, which will cause the end pointer to increase and surpass allocated memory. With a specially crafted request (e.g. via the OPTIONS method), a remote attacker can cause a loss of availability for the program.
CVE-2013-7401.extra: A remote attacker may cause a Denial of Service condition.

CVE-2013-7422.title: Perl: Denial of service — GLSA 201507-11
CVE-2013-7422.subTitle: A vulnerability in Perl allows a remote attacker to cause Denial of Service.
CVE-2013-7422.background: Perl is a highly capable, feature-rich programming language.
CVE-2013-7422.body: S_regmatch() function lacks proper checks before passing arguments to atoi()
CVE-2013-7422.extra: A remote attacker could send a specially crafted input, possibly resulting in a Denial of Service condition.

CVE-2013-7459.title: PyCrypto: Remote execution of arbitrary code — GLSA 201702-14
CVE-2013-7459.subTitle: A heap-based buffer overflow in PyCrypto might allow remote attackers to execute arbitrary code.
CVE-2013-7459.background: The Python Cryptography Toolkit (PyCrypto) is a collection of both secure hash functions (such as SHA256 and RIPEMD160), and various encryption algorithms (AES, DES, RSA, ElGamal, etc.).
CVE-2013-7459.body: A heap-based buffer overflow vulnerability has been discovered in PyCrypto. Please review the CVE identifier referenced below for details.
CVE-2013-7459.extra: A remote attacker, able to control the mode of operation in PyCrypto’s AES module, could possibly execute arbitrary code with the privileges of the process or cause a Denial of Service condition.
